extendedIngredients.name: chicken breast halves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 bone-in chicken breast halves (8 ounces each), skinless

extendedIngredients.name: green beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups fresh or frozen cut green beans

extendedIngredients.name: sweet potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks

recipes.title: Golden Chicken and Autumn Vegetables

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large nonstick skillet, brown chicken over medium-high heat for 4-6 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer reads 170°. Add sweet potatoes and beans.                                                                                            In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients; pour over chicken and vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until heated through.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Golden Chicken and Autumn Vegetables in  Quick CookingDecember 2000, p33                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 each) equals 160 calories, 1 g fat (trace saturated fat), 23 mg cholesterol, 265 mg sodium, 27 g carbohydrate, 5 g fiber, 11 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large nonstick skillet, brown chicken over medium-high heat for 4-6 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer reads 170°.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients; pour over chicken and vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until heated through.
